text:
I want to minimize 1/2 Abs[-x2 y1 + x3 y1 + x1 y2 - x3 y2 - x1 y3 + x2 y3] subject to 800kb of constraint in text form. The constraint uses &&, ||, <=, >=. != on sums of multinomials over the 6 variables mentioned above. I know that optimal values are irrational.
Is there any tool in Julia i could use to call this without retyping all the terms?
I know there are multiple identical glocabl minimas.

>  any tool in Julia i could use to call this without retyping all the terms?
Besides parsing the text and building, e.g., a big optimization problem?

elements.text: any tool in Julia i could use to call this without retyping all the terms?
Besides parsing the text and building, e.g., a big optimization problem?

text: Well i would need an optimizer than can handle those types of terms.
And these variables are not binary, are they?

elements.text: And these variables are not binary, are they?

text: JuMP itself might be insufficient since i'm not aware of support for multinomials or &&, ||, != on equations over the reals.
Right. As far as I can tell, you are correct.

elements.text: Right. As far as I can tell, you are correct.

text: (meaning there might exist a way to do it, but I don't know about it)

elements.text: (meaning there might exist a way to do it, but I don't know about it)

text: I just wanted to check that with other ecosystem aware people.
